reviews.text:
Good access to Abbey Wood Shopping Park and the cycle lane.

Quite bare bones as others have said but is tidy.
There are no barriers to  insert your ticket but there are people from morning to afternoon that check your ticket!
Its facilities are only just adequate. Hard station to find too.

A bare bones station but it has good live arrivals info  and a bloke in a ticket office. Good access to the cycle path and also in easy reach of the shopping centre. Platforms have sheltered waiting areas.

The most recent upgrades between Bristol Temple Meads and Parkway include the doubling of the lines to 4, allowing more trains to run.
It serves trains to and from Cardiff, Gloucester, Great Malvern, Bristol, Weston Super Mare, Weymouth, Taunton and Portsmouth.
The 3 original platforms all have access ramps (no steps) but the new platform only has steps, which are narrower than most. The bridge connecting the platforms weaves all over the place and could take some time to move from one side to the other, depending how many people are there.
Overall, it's a nice relatively tidy station with good service links.
